1333-d-07-04-10-IHB.Narrative: ON JULY 4, 2010, AT APPROXIMATELY 6:05 PM, IHB RUN 324 WAS SWITCHING CARS IN GIBSON YARD IN HAMMOND,IN. CREW WAS SHOVING IN TRACK GR09 FROM THE EAST END AND SHOVED CAR TTGX 990559 OUT OF TRACK GR09 ON THE WEST END INTO THE SIDE OF CAR TTGX 975136 ON TRACK GR11, DERAILING TTGX 990559 AND DAMAGING TTGX 975136.

0710RS013-d-07-21-10-UP.Narrative: CREW HAD SHOVED WESTWARD ON THE NORTH PASS AND CUT OFF THE UP2576 IN THE "OS" AT CPF531, THEN PULLEDEASTWARD OVER TRACK 714 SWITCH.  AS CREW WAS SHOVING INTO 714 AT 3 MPH, THE UP2576 BEGAN TO ROLL EASTWARD DUE TO THE ENGINE NOT BEING PROPERLY SECURED AND THE AIR BRAKES HAD BLED OFF FROM THE EMERGENCY APPLICATION FROM WHEN IT HAD BEEN CUT AWAY.  THE UP2576 ROLLED AT 1.4 MPH, 55 FT AND COLLIDED WITH THE CARS BEING SHOVED INTO TRACK 714.

0705101-d-07-05-10-PHL.Narrative: IN RCL MODE, ENGINEER WAS IN CONTROL OF THE LOCOMOTIVE AND ENTERED THE YARD BEFORE GIVEN INSTRUCTIONBY THE APL TOWER. THE ENGINEER PROCEED TOWARDS TRACK 22 SOUTH THINKING ALL OF THE DERAIL WARNING LIGHTS WERE DARK. AS HE PROCEEDED, HE NOTICED THAT THERE WAS A DERAIL UP AND PLUGGED THE LOCOMOTIVE, BUT WAS UNABLE TO STOP THE TRAIN IN TIME AND DERAILED THE FIRST 2 AXLES OF THE LOCOMOTIVE.

AZER072310-d-07-23-10-AZER.Narrative: TRAIN WAS PROCEEDING DOWN LOW LINE TO THE MIAMI YARD WITH OUTBOUND, WHEN CONDUCTOR NOTICED THAT THECARS WERE ON THE GROUND. THAT'S WHEN THE ENGINEER WAS TOLD TO GO INTO EMERGENCY. UPON SUPERINTENDENT'S ARRIVAL HE NOTICED THAT THE WHEELS WERE ON THE INSIDE OF THE NORTH RAIL AND OPPOSITE SIDE HAD WHEELS RIDING ON THE TURN RAIL. SUPERINTENDENT WALKED UP TO THE REAR OF THE TRAIN AND NOTICED WHERE THEWHEEL HAD FALLEN OFF RAIL, CAUSING THE OPPOSITE SIDE TO TURN, IN TURN; CAUSING CAR TO DERAIL. BACKFOUR HOPPERS DID NOT TRAVEL VERY FAR.

CONDUCTOR GAVE ENGINEER THAT WILL DO, BUT RADIO FAILED.  ENGINEER STOPPED IN SEVEN CARS BECAUSE HE DID NOT HEAR ANOTHER CAR COUNT.  REAR OF CUT ROLLED THROUGH SPLIT SWITCH DERAIL AND DERAILED 5 CARS.  RADIO WAS VERIFIED BAD.

0710PD010-d-07-18-10-UP.Narrative: YBA76-17 HAD FINISHED PULLING EMPTIES OUT OF TRACK 784 AND WAS SHOVING 68 LOADS OF WHEAT BACK INTO TRACK 784.  FOREMAN WAS RIDING POINT FOR PROTECTION WHEN HE SAW THE LIGHTS GO OUT AND MOVEMENT STOPPED AS THEY WENT INTO EMERGENCY.  HE SAW 2 CARS WERE ON THEIR SIDE.  INVESTIGATION REVEALED THAT THE 790 SWITCH THAT COMES OFF TRACK 784 HAD NOT BEEN LOCKED INTO POSITION AND HAD FREE ROAMING POINTS.  THE FOREMAN STATED HE NEVER THREW THE SWITCH.  IT WAS FOUND THAT A LONG SHOREMAN HAD BEEN WORKING ONTHE SWITCH EARLIER THAT NIGHT AND LEFT SWITCH OUT OF CORRESPONDENCE AND DID NOT LOCK IT INTO POSITION WHICH RESULTED IN THE 3-CAR DERAILMENT.  COLUMBIA GRAIN INTERNATIONAL MAINTAINS TRACK.

WHEN THE TRAIN BEGAN TO MOVE THE REAR OF THECAR STARTED DOWN THE ADJACENT TRACK, WHICH SKEWED THE CAR UNTIL IT DERAILED, STRIKING OTHER STANDINGEQUIPMENT AND DAMAGING BOTH CARS INVOLVED.

07272010A-d-07-27-10-TMBL.Primary Accident Cause: Other miscellaneous causes (Provide detailed description in narrative)
07272010A-d-07-27-10-TMBL.Accident Cause: Other miscellaneous causes (Provide detailed description in narrative)
07272010A-d-07-27-10-TMBL.Narrative:
CREW WAS SHOVING WEST. SWITCH FOREMAN WAS ON THE POINT. HE FELT SOMETHING STRANGE, TURNED TO LOOKBACK & SAW A BIG CLOUD OF DUST. HE IMMEDIATELY TOLD THE ENGINEER TO "PLUG THEM". SWITCH FOREMAN STATEDTHAT THE DERAIL WAS DOWN WHEN THEY ORIGINALLY SHOVED OVER IT, BUT NOW IT WAS UP. SIGNS & SYMPTOMS PERFORMED - NO REASON FOR SUSPICION. INVESTIGATION REVEALED THAT ALTHOUGH THE DERAIL HAS A LOCKON IT,IN THE NON-DERAILING POSITION IT IS ABLE TO BE THROWN INTO THE DERAILING POSITION. IT IS POSSIBLE THAT THE DERAIL WAS CAUGHT BY SOMETHING HANGING LOW ON A RAIL CAR AND PULLED INTO THE DERAILING POSITION. 

RERAILING COST IS ESTIMATED AT $19,000.

AMENDED REPORT:	04/14/2014
Q 38 – CHANGED TO M599
Q 52 - INVESTIGATION OF THIS INCIDENT REVEALED THE FOLLOWING:
NO EVIDENCE OF DEFECT OR TAMPERINGTO THE DERAIL OR TRACK. 
THE DERAIL WORKED AS IT IS INTENDED TO.
DURING NORMAL SWITCHING ACTIVITY& WHILE NO CONTRACTORS ARE PRESENT, THE DERAIL IS LOCKED INTO THE OPEN, NON-DERAILING POSITION.THE DERAIL WAS PLACED FOR PROTECTION OF THE CIVIL CONTRACTOR ACTIVITIES WHEN THEY WERE FOULINGTHE TRACKS DURING CONSTRUCTION OF A STREET OVERPASS.
IT WAS DETERMINED THAT SOMETHING CAUGHT THE DERAIL DURING THE TRAIN MOVEMENT.
THE MECHANICAL AGENT INSPECTING THE RAILCARS WAS UNABLE TO IDENTIFYIF ONE OF THE PIECES TORN OFF THE RAILCAR OR IF SOME FOREIGN MATERIAL IS WHAT CAUGHT OR STRUCK THEDERAIL.  MARKS ON THE DERAIL ITSELF CONFIRM SOMETHING HIT & KNOCKED THE DERAIL INTO THE FLANGEWAY.
